TopicTitle: How to Balance this Rover Rocket

Articles.Content:
I have build this Rover Rocket and i cant handle it. Every time i will launch this the rocket turns to the left side. I have 4 Versions of this Rocket and everytime happens the same. It is fullly symmetric (Left and right) but he is still turning around.

To understand what about i am talking here, i want to upload the Craft files.

http://www.file-upload.net/download-7732129/Useless-Minmus-Rover.rar.html

I am not sure how to do this with this Page but i upload the files with an other internetside. Hope this is ok.
I'm not able to check the craft myself atm (or start up KSP), but did you check the center of mass, and center of thrust? Might be that they are off, even if you used symetry

Could you post a screenshot? It's always easier, sometimes we don't need a .craft file.

Also on your CoT and CoM: is your CoT directly over your CoM? That would explain why it's uncontrollable.

I just tested your ships. On #3 you are using engine LV-T30 which has no vectoring so it will not steer. Use engine LV-T45. It has vectoring and goes straight.

As for #4 if you check your balance you will see that the thrust/mass is slightly skewed. I haven't tested far enough to see why this is.

A solution I use when I have strange craft is the DRAkTEC-VTOL-pack. It has some engines in it which can be used for throttle streering and work like a charm when you have an unbalanced load.

In #4 your rover is unbalanced and will not land properly either. Check out the VTOL pack. It can cure some of those problems.
